page.title: 01Gazetteer
page.content: The most important feature in our area is the agriculture. The majority of the land is arable farm land. The main crops being wheat,barley,oil-seed rape and potatoes. There are a few fruit farms. The land is flat and the fields are separated by hedges and ditches. Small copses break up the landscape. There are small residential areas. The largest ones being at Leaden Roding and White Roding. There are several 15th and 16th Century thatched cottages. The area has only a small interest in industry, however this may alter with the development of Stansted Airport. Many of the people are employed on the land ,however a lot of people also commute,travelling to Harlow, Chelmsford and even to London.
